Author: ANTON MCCONVILLE & Others
name: CloudCo Insurance App
description: Insurance Policy Bot is a collection of experimental Watson & Bluemix concepts applied to the insurance domain.

Author: ANTON MCCONVILLE
name: David Bowie personalities
description: Exploring David Bowie's lyrics with Python, Watson & Bluemix

Author: ANTON MCCONVILLE
name: Watson Spreadsheet
description: This is a Node application that reads questions and answers from a Google Spreadsheet and runs Watson Tone Analysis on the answers. It writes the measured tone into rows of the Spreadsheet.
services: Tone Analyzer, Watson Alchemy Concept Analysis

Author: Twana Daniel
name: Migrate an application from Azure to Bluemix
description: This tutorial will take you step by step from creating a NodeJS app on Azure and then migrating that app onto IBM Bluemix

Author: Twana Daniel
name: Deploy to Bluemix PHP codeigniter CRUD App
description: We will use PHP as the runtime and codeigniter as our framework, we will then bind the application to the database using the ClearDB MySql service on Bluemix and and deploy it to Bluemix.

Author: FREDERIC LAVIGNE & Others
name: Logistics-wizard App
description: Controller for the Logistics Wizard showcase demo. The Logistics Wizard is an end-to-end, smart supply chain management solution that showcases how to execute hybrid cloud, microservices, and predictive data analytics in the real world.

Author: FREDERIC LAVIGNE
name: SOmusic Web App
description: Music from social network - collect Spotify links in Twitter and build ranking

Author: FREDERIC LAVIGNE
name: Insights Search
description: Query interface for the Twitter service. Build your query visually.

Author: FREDERIC LAVIGNE
name: Insights Weather
description: What's the weather like near you?

Author: FREDERIC LAVIGNE
name: Places Insights Lab
description: Mixing Twitter and Weather to find places to visit

Author: FREDERIC LAVIGNE
name: Serverless Slack app
description: This sample shows how to build a serverless Slack app using Slack Events API to receive events, with IBM Bluemix OpenWhisk actions to process these events, and how to expose these actions with API Connect.

Author: FREDERIC LAVIGNE
name: Image tagging and face detection app IOS
description: Vision App is a sample iOS application to automatically tag images and detect faces by using IBM visual recognition technologies.

Author: Ram Vennam
name: Hybrid Banking App Demo
description: Hybrid Banking Demo - Interaction of Customer on Mobile Device with Banking Service Center. Application that demos interaction between a customer and company support staff using Bluemix Mobile backend and Watson services.

Author: Ram Vennam
name: Sample Stock Trading application in Java EE
description: Build and deploy the application to Bluemix, and consume a database services and other services in the cloud.

Author: Ram Vennam
name: Talent Manager
description: Talent Manager allows you to find a developer with same set of skills and personalities like your other staff members. This is possible using the IBM personality insights service.

Author: Jake Peyser
name: Real Time Tone Analysis Application
description: Real Time Tone Analysis samples dictation or conversations and displays a real-time transcription and an accompanying chart that plots the emotional, social, and writing tone of the language.

Author: Jake Peyser
name: Capital Weather
description: Capital Weather is a sample Bluemix application which utilizes the Weather Channel service, two mapping APIs, Leaflet and Esri Leaflet, and the Google Maps Geocoding API. It allows users to visualize the current weather in all the world capitals, as well as obtain historical weather data and future weather projections. The app provides a real world use case of the Weather Channel API and implements several of the methods exposed by that interface.

Author: Jake Peyser
name: Banking and minimum viable services
description: New Bluemix sample app demonstrating how modern, user-centric banking apps can be built and run on Bluemix using microservice architecture.

Author: Jake Peyser
name: Personality Box Overview
description: Personality Box pulls the .txt files from your Box acount and allows you to analyze the unique personality traits of each file's author using the Watson Personality Insights API. For sample files, feel free to use either President Obama's 2015 State of the Union Address or Moby Dick - Chapter 1 hosted in our Box account.

Author: Jake Peyser
name: Supply Chain Weather Overview
description: Supply Chain Weather is a sample Bluemix application which utilizes the Insights for Weather service and two mapping APIs, Leaflet and Esri Leaflet to dynamically create and augment shipments for a retail chain store's supply chain.
services: Insights for Weather, Leaflet, Esri Leaflet

Author: ANDREW TRICE
name: Awesome skylink
description: Skylink is a sample application that lets you connect a DJI drone aircraft to the IBM Cloud with near realtime image analysis leveraging IBM Cloudant, OpenWhisk, IBM Watson, and Alchemy Vision.

Author: Jeff Sloyer
name: Facebook Photo Analyzer
description: A sample/demo app that uses IBM Bluemix to analyze the objects in photos on Facebook via IBM Watson and analyzes the sentiment of the comments on photos via the Alchemy API.

Author: Bluemix & Watson Team
name: ChatBot - Car Dashboard
description: Application that demonstrates how the Conversation service uses intent capabilities in an animated car dashboard UI.

Author: Bluemix & Watson Team
name: Todo Web App
description: The ToDo sample apps are meant to be simple demos of how you can take advantage of Bluemix and a database service done in number different langauges.
language: NodeJS, Java, PHP, Python, Rails, Swift

Author: Bluemix & Watson Team
name: Your Celebrity Match
description: Compare your Twitter profile against celebrities.

Author: Bluemix & Watson Team
name: Metric Collector
description: A lightweight web-tracking app to record user actions on a single-page webapp. Uses Piwik web analytics library to collect information and Node.js to store in Cloudant.
